snippet: A ranking security official said Saturday morning that two people had been arrested in connection with the attack, for which a group of extremists are said to have claimed responsibility.
abstract: Security offiicals in Mali report terrorist attack after gunman opens fire on restaurant in capital city of Bamako, killing at least five people, including two Europeans; Al Mourabitoun, group that split off from Al Qaeda, has reportedly claimed responsibility.

byline.contributor: Cheick Diouara contributed from Bamako, Mali.

lead_paragraph: A ranking security official said Saturday morning that two people had been arrested in connection with the attack, for which a group of extremists are said to have claimed responsibility.

headline.main: Gunman Kills Five in Restaurant in Mali
headline.print_headline: Gunman Kills Five in Restaurant in Mali
